alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 07 at 6:41PM EDT until September 08 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Beach Hazards Statement, a high risk of rip currents and rough nearshore surf. * WHERE...Virginia Beach. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 10 PM EDT this evening. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, shallow flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline resulting in a low threat of property damage. Expect up to one foot of water above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks and lawns near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. For the Beach Hazards Statement, breaking waves of 4 to 6 ft will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 07/08 PM 4.6 1.8 1.4 3 MINOR 08/08 AM 4.4 1.6 1.6 3 NONE 08/09 PM 4.9 2.1 1.6 3 MINOR 09/09 AM 4.5 1.7 1.5 3 MINOR 09/09 PM 4.8 2.0 1.5 2-3 MINOR 10/10 AM 4.3 1.5 1.2 1-2 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 07/07 PM 4.6 1.7 1.2 3-4 NONE 08/07 AM 4.4 1.5 1.4 3-4 NONE 08/08 PM 4.9 2.0 1.4 3-4 NONE 09/08 AM 4.6 1.7 1.4 3-4 NONE 09/08 PM 4.7 1.8 1.2 3-4 NONE 10/09 AM 4.2 1.3 0.8 3 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 07/07 PM 4.5 1.8 1.6 1 MINOR 08/08 AM 4.3 1.6 1.8 1 NONE 08/08 PM 4.8 2.1 1.8 1 MINOR 09/09 AM 4.5 1.8 1.8 1 MINOR 09/09 PM 4.6 1.9 1.6 1 MINOR 10/09 AM 4.0 1.3 1.2 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
